result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Defendant Alexander B McAllister in court.  Attorney Laura Federico in court for Alexander B McAllister.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:17 PM Defendant Alexander B McAllister in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states he applied to Public Defender and is eligible. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
James Jaworski is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is an officer with the Grand Rapids Police Department. On 7/19/22, he stopped a vehicle and defendant was a passenger in the vehicle. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He observed an odor of marijuana coming from the vehicle. He tested a substance he found in the vehicle and it tested positive for THC.
Attorney Lambert asks Court take judicial notice of Wood County case 18CF164, a prior drug conviction.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 30, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

9:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander B McAllister in court. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for a preliminary hearing and arraignment. Not guilty is entered on the misd. Bond is continued.
